file_content.text: Good to see you again--but I don't think the Black Sun feels the same way.
Haven't heard an explosion in a good while. Guess that means you defused those crates.
I think I found them all. Let's hope Black Sun doesn't get any more.
I did the job.
We'll make sure. No more people will be killed looking for food.
Ran into some thugs....
Black Sun's more than a match for security. I'm glad you were here to help.
Just don't ask me to defuse any more.
Yes, but never again.
I won't. You've done your part.
Now, I'm no rich Senator, but let me give you a little something for taking care of this. Recognition.
I appreciate it.
The price is well worth it for my peace of mind. We all just got to do what we can.
It's a generous offer, but I can't accept.
No reward is necessary.
A Jedi has no need of such things.
No reward is necessary.
I don't expect a reward for doing my duty.
Not necessary.
Look, I don't normally do charity, but... let's say someone owes me a drink, okay?
Not necessary.
Rare to find someone not out to make a profit.
That's it?
I wish I had more to give. I guess saving lives doesn't pay like it used to.
You probably have other business, so I won't keep you. Watch your back out there.
I want to know when those crates have been defused. In the meantime, I'm warning people to avoid them.
Well, look at this. A Jedi! This is something special--feel like I should've polished my boots.
What do you know? It's good to see another brave soul, soldier. Come on over.
Hey there. Always good to see another brave soul--there aren't many of us left.
I'm Captain Theraguin--last officer on the job here since the patrols stopped. Welcome to Black Sun territory.
What do you mean by that?
Black Sun?
I take it you're new here. Black Sun--Coruscant's nastiest gang. They've infested this entire sector.
Are you saying there's no security down here?
"Last officer"?
You kidding me? My commander gave up on this sector a long time ago. I shouldn't even be here.
I know where I am. I can handle myself.
I don't need a tour guide.
Fair enough. You know how bad Black Sun's gotten, then--the gang has complete control.
The locals only venture out of their apartments when they have to scrounge for supplies.
Now with no security forces, what future do they have? And Black Sun has a new game. Call it "Boom."
Uh-oh.
"Boom"?
I enjoy a good game, now and then.
Sounds like fun.
Not like this, you don't. I don't think.
Black Sun steals Republic supply crates, takes the supplies out, then rigs the crates with explosives.
Then they set the trapped crates in the street; make bets on how long before some fool tries to open them.
Why would anyone do a thing like that?
That's sickening.
I don't know. You want to be charitable, assume Black Sun doesn't think straight.
It takes a dark soul to do such a thing.
That's sickening.
Didn't believe it until I saw it with my own eyes--this mousy little woman--blown to pieces.
Only cowards attack civilian targets.
That's sickening.
Yeah. It's one thing when the gangs shoot at us--but killing innocents for fun?
Whatever happened to a friendly game of sabacc?
That's sickening.
Whatever happened to petty criminals who weren't sadists?
Hasn't someone tried to do something?
And people allow this?
The locals don't know what's going on. And like I said before, security can't patrol here anymore.
Some people need to learn a hard lesson about stealing public property.
Dirty scavengers.
I hope you're kidding.
I try to defuse the crates myself--the mechanics are simple, but Black Sun's everywhere. Nearly killed me last time.
I can handle Black Sun. I want to make things right.
I'd like to help.
That's--thank you. That's just what I needed to hear.
I see where you're going.
You got the idea. Saw you comin' and thought "maybe we can save a few lives."
Now, Black Sun's explosives are pretty simple. I can show you what to do.
Anything you can do... I'll be more than grateful. But be damn careful.
So what? [Refuse quest]
Fine. You might change your mind if you see an innocent person get blasted.
Watch your step down here--Black Sun's dangerous.
